28b82b38-bf2a-4819-abdf-ba4657ba8574.description: This badge demonstrates that the earner has developed the skills and habits that lead to successful learning not only in future training endeavors, but also for the workplace and continued professional learning tasks. Earners are able to apply various strategies for effective learning, apply critical thinking and problem-solving strategies and skills to learning tasks, and deploy self-assessment, and self-correcting strategies for workplace learning, and ongoing professional development.
28b82b38-bf2a-4819-abdf-ba4657ba8574.name: Ready to Learn

issuer.summary: issued by National Workforce Career Association (NWCA)

bcebb555-6837-40bb-9495-9cbcce8d611f.description: This credential documents competency in the comprehension, structure, and proper use of medical terms across an array of medical specialties as well as the anatomy and physiology concepts necessary for success as an entry level medical professional. Earners with this badge have completed a course of study in both medical terminology and anatomy and physiology as it pertains to their selected field.

11539887-80b2-4f48-a247-57fb9b3a680b.description: This credential is designed to document the knowledge base for phlebotomists who work in a variety of settings, including those who are a part of the laboratory team, paramedics, and point-of-care healthcare workers. Areas of assessment include the phlebotomistÍs role and profession, infection control and safety, quality assurance, anatomy and physiology, medical terminology, phlebotomy equipment and procedures, point-of-care testing, and special populations and procedures.

e572f929-a0ad-488f-8608-b5a4368e8dc9.description: This badge demonstrates that the earner has successfully completed training and passed related assessments on a variety of soft skill necessary for success on the job. Mastered topics include learner success, critical thinking and professional development, essential job search and career success skills (resume writing, networking, interviewing), customer service and sales, workplace safety and infection control, as well as overall workplace readiness and professionalism skills.

2347b981-7aa7-4a0a-8619-ac742bc3fae2.description: This credential is designed to document the acquisition of basic administrative and clinical skills required for the medical assistant. 9841102d-7fad-4b1e-a2c7-8bd38f598900.description: The purpose of this credential is to document the proficiency of selected healthcare workers in the knowledge, skills, and techniques involved in EKG technology. EKG Technicians understand human anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology as related to the cardiovascular system, set up an EKG machine and Holter monitor, prepare the patient for and run EKG tests, recognize normal EKG tracings vs. abnormal tracings and make appropriate reports to the physicians.

issuer.summary: issued by National Workforce Career Association (NWCA)

bf68ac7c-a503-440c-b20f-ec59e40cc4a8.description: This credential documents the essential skills for a medical coder working in various health settings. The successful medical coder will demonstrate proficiency with coding manuals and have the ability to extract coding information from medical documentation with a thorough knowledge of anatomy, physiology and medical terminology including reading medical charts, ICD-10-CM diagnoses , CPT medical procedures, and HCPCS Level II and ICD-10-PCS coding requirements.

b93451d6-3175-4806-b131-e17fa8a387ee.description: This credential documents the competencies required for establishing a positive and proactive career mindset. b93451d6-3175-4806-b131-e17fa8a387ee.name: Career Success & Professionalism

78d2b121-f5f5-49da-83fa-ccb45e7fcdb7.description: Credentials in Medical Billing & Coding demonstrate competencies including reading medical charts, coding diagnoses using ICD-10-CM, coding medical procedures using CPT, and having familiarity with HCPCS Level II and ICD-10-PCS coding requirements. Specifically, this badge demonstrates the earner's ability to apply knowledge of the guidelines, rules, and terminology related to coding Anesthesia services. Given a scenario or medical records data, correctly code Anesthesia services.
78d2b121-f5f5-49da-83fa-ccb45e7fcdb7.name: CPT Coding: Anesthesia Guidelines

issuer.summary: issued by National Workforce Career Association (NWCA)

badge_template_activities.title: Must achieve a passing score on the exam.

443a51e0-42f1-41cc-835a-d5e50ae14a95.description: This credential documents development of skills for healthcare professionals who collect blood, urine, fecal specimens, seminal fluid, sputum, and other body specimens. Specifically, this badge demonstrates the earner's ability to define medical terminology and abbreviations commonly used in the clinical laboratory setting, explain the anatomy and physiology associated with phlebotomy procedures, and explain the anatomy and physiology associated with phlebotomy procedures.
443a51e0-42f1-41cc-835a-d5e50ae14a95.name: Phlebotomy Medical Terminology, A&P, and the Lymphatic System

issuer.summary: issued by National Workforce Career Association (NWCA)

badge_template_activities.title: Must achieve a passing score on the exam.

290ec562-5aa2-4374-b139-a502f839ab1c.description: These credentials document competencies in basic writing tasks including how to write using basic grammar and punctuation, how to write with style, how to follow a logical writing process and plan a writing project, how to revise and proofread writing, and how to effectively format a writing piece. Specifically, this badge demonstrates the earner's ability to explain the importance and strategies for analyzing, revising, proofreading, and formatting an essay.
290ec562-5aa2-4374-b139-a502f839ab1c.name: Revising, Proofreading, and Formatting

issuer.summary: issued by National Workforce Career Association (NWCA)
